title: GPS generated traffic information
abstract: Disclosed herein is a traveler information monitoring and dissemination system. The system disclosed herein provides real time information to a traveler, wherein the real time information may be pre-selected by the traveler. The system ensures consistent and quality data are produced and issued to the traveler.
claims:
1. A method for disseminating traveler specific information, the method comprising:
receiving a preferred travel route from a user using a user device, wherein the preferred travel route is displayed on the user device;
executing instructions stored in memory, wherein execution of the instructions by a processor:
stores user criteria, organized by location codes, regarding particular traffic incidents wherein the user criteria comprises selection by a user of:
at least one segment of the preferred travel route, wherein the at least one segment contains a particular location code,
a time range, and
at least one type of traffic incident for which the user will receive notifications;
receives current incident data relating to traveling conditions from at least one data source, wherein the received current incident data includes data regarding a particular traffic incident from a plurality of different sources associated with the preferred travel route, wherein the received incident data regarding the particular traffic incident from each source is different;
receives traffic flow data associated with the particular traffic incident, wherein the received traffic flow data is traffic flow data over a period of time that has been averaged and filtered;
standardizes information about the particular traffic incident based on the incident data and traffic flow data; and
processes the received current incident data, received traffic flow data and the user criteria to produce:
data based on the current incident data and traffic flow data and comprising information that corresponds to the selected user criteria, and
a unique identification code for each incident identified in the data; and
provides the data to the user according to the user criteria, wherein the provided data is published as a packaged data set for each particular traffic incident based on the standardized information, and wherein the packaged data set is displayed for the user to view on the user device associated with the preferred travel route.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the different incident data includes location-based information obtained from an address associated with an equipment identification number of a particular source and location-based information obtained from geographic terms inclusive of latitude and longitude.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein standardizing information about the particular traffic incident includes assigning a unique identification for the particular traffic incident.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the assigned unique identification for the particular traffic incident corresponds to a particular graphical icon displayed on the preferred travel route that represents the published packaged data set for the particular traffic incident.
5. The method of claim 3 further comprising eliminating redundant incident from the plurality of different sources using the assigned unique identification.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the external sources includes a clock, wherein the clock is used to calculate end-times for the particular traffic incident.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein standardizing information about the particular traffic incident includes assigning a severity level for the particular traffic incident.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein standardizing information about the particular traffic incident includes projecting an end time for the particular traffic incident.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein standardizing information about the particular traffic incident includes correcting description information associated with the particular traffic incident associated with each source.
